title: Mary Peters interview: 'I've had the most amazing life through sport - now I want to inspire the next generation of women'
text:
It was when Lady Mary Peters contacted her local bookshop and asked for a comparison between how many books they had about sportsmen and sportswomen that she became convinced by the need for her latest project. “Hundreds about men - and four about women,” she says, understandably incredulous at the imbalance.

That ratio will now improve by at least one following the publication of a book by Peters which, rather than tell the remarkable story of her own life, focuses instead on those of 96 other inspiring sportswomen. The title, Passing The Torch, is also apt - it was what she physically did at London 2012 and, at the age now of 80 and after major heart surgery last year, is what she still does with as much vigour as ever.

“I’ve had the most amazing life through sport - the joy of travel, opportunities, friendship and health,” she says. “I just want to inspire the next generation. I think so many children these days will have arthritic thumbs with iPads and iPhones but just reading a story of somebody else’s success can make them wonder, ‘Can I do that?’ Of course they can. And you don’t need to be a champion to succeed in sport. You just need to enjoy the journey.”
